subject: Philosophy
title: Why Does Anything Exist?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Does Anything Exist?.

hook.text: Nothing would be simpler than something. So why does anything exist at all?

buildup.text: Leibniz called this the ultimate question. Every explanation leads to another 'but why?'

discovery.text: Some say God is the answer. But then who created God? The chain never ends.

twist.text: Physicists say quantum fluctuations can create matter from nothing. But laws had to exist first.

climax.text: After three thousand years, philosophy's hardest question remains completely unanswered.

punchline.text: The deepest question has no answer yet.

quiz.question: Who called 'why is there something rather than nothing' the ultimate question?
